info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 10:31AM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
At 1031 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from 5 miles south of Clintonville to 17 miles south of Babcock, or extending from 17 miles south of Shawano to 30 miles southwest of Wisconsin Rapids, moving southeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
The strong thunderstorm will be near... Waupaca, Hartman Creek State Park, Clintonville and Amherst around 1035 AM CDT. Chain O' Lakes-King and Plainfield around 1040 AM CDT. Black Creek around 1100 AM CDT. Fremont, Wautoma and Napowan Scout Camp around 1105 AM CDT. Appleton around 1115 AM CDT. Lake Poygan, Redgranite and Little Chute around 1120 AM CDT. Kaukauna, Kimberly, Menasha and Northern Lake Winnebago around 1125 AM CDT.
Other locations impacted by this strong thunderstorm include Fitzgerald Corners, Manawa, Bear Creek, Sheridan, Ogdensburg, Symco, Bancroft, Deer Creek Wildlife Area, Scandinavia and Keene.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

parameter.value: A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WAUPACA...PORTAGE... WAUSHARA...NORTHERN WINNEBAGO...OUTAGAMIE AND SOUTHERN WOOD COUNTIES UNTIL 1130 AM CDT

area.areaDesc: Wood; Portage; Waupaca; Outagamie; Waushara; Winnebago
